SEARCH
Module hanyaeger
Package com.github.hanyaeger.core.entities

Class SpriteAnimationDelegate

java.lang.Object
com.github.hanyaeger.core.entities.SpriteAnimationDelegate
All Implemented Interfaces:
Updatable
public class SpriteAnimationDelegate extends Object implements Updatable
A SpriteAnimationDelegate holds all responsibility related to Sprites that contain multiple images.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    SpriteAnimationDelegate(javafx.scene.image.ImageView imageView, int rows, int columns)
    Create a new SpriteAnimationDelegate for the given ImageView and number of rows and columns.

  • Constructor Details

    • SpriteAnimationDelegate

      public SpriteAnimationDelegate(javafx.scene.image.ImageView imageView, int rows, int columns)
      Create a new SpriteAnimationDelegate for the given ImageView and number of rows and columns. After construction, the spriteIndex will be set to the first frame (top-left).
      Parameters:
      imageView - the ImageView for which the different frames should be created
      rows - the number of rows available
      columns - the number of columns available

  • Method Details

    • setFrameIndex

      public void setFrameIndex(int index)
      Set the index of the sprite. Since the modulus (mod frames) is used, this can be an unbounded integer.
      Parameters:
      index - the index to select. This index will be applied modulo the total number of frames

    • getFrameIndex

      public int getFrameIndex()
      Return the current index of the sprite.
      Returns:
      the index of the sprite as an int

    • update

      public void update(long timestamp)
      Description copied from interface: Updatable
      The update() method is called each frame.

      Use this method to init frame-based behaviour to the game-object.

      Specified by:
      update in interface Updatable
      Parameters:
      timestamp - the timestamp of this update

    • setAutoCycle

      public void setAutoCycle(long interval, int row)
      Set the interval at which the sprite should be automatically cycled and which row to cycle through.
      Parameters:
      interval - the interval in milliseconds
      row - the row to cycle through (zero-indexed)

    • setAutoCycleInterval

      public void setAutoCycleInterval(long interval)
      set the interval at which the sprite should be automatically cycled. The row will remain the same. To set the row that needs to be cycled, use the method setAutoCycleRow(int), or setAutoCycle(long, int) to set them both at once.
      Parameters:
      interval - the interval in milliseconds

    • getAutoCycleInterval

      public long getAutoCycleInterval()
      Return the current auto-cycle interval
      Returns:
      the current auto-cycle interval in milliseconds

    • setAutoCycleRow

      public void setAutoCycleRow(int row)
      Set the row through which the sprite should be automatically cycled.
      Parameters:
      row - the row to cycle through (zero-indexed)

    • getCyclingRow

      public int getCyclingRow()
      Return the row that is currently set as the only row to cycle through. If a value of -1 is returned, all rows are cycled through.
      Returns:
      the cycling row

    • playAnimation

      public void playAnimation(Animation animation, boolean restartIfSame)
      Play the given FiniteAnimation. The actual settings of the FiniteAnimation can be set through the constructor of FiniteAnimation.
      Parameters:
      animation - the FiniteAnimation to be played
      restartIfSame - if the same Animation is currently being played, this boolean states if the Animation should be restarted or should continue with the current frame.

    • getCurrentAnimation

      public Animation getCurrentAnimation()
      Return the Animation that is currently being played. If the Animation has ended, the behaviour is based on the type of Animation. If the current animation is a FiniteAnimation, this method will return null when it has finished.
      Returns:
      the Animation that is currently being played or null if none are played

    • queueAnimation

      public void queueAnimation(Animation animation)
      Queue the given Animation ensures it is played after the current Animation, regardless of the type of the current Animation. the queued Animation will overwrite both the next Animation as defined in a LinkedAnimation and overwrite the looping behaviour of a LoopingAnimation.

      To un-queue the queued Animation, call unQueueAnimation().

      Parameters:
      animation - the Animation to be queued
      Throws:
      com.github.hanyaeger.core.exceptions.YaegerEngineException - thrown if no Animation is currently being played

    • unQueueAnimation

      public Animation unQueueAnimation()
      Call this method to un-queue the Animation that is currently queued. This method must be called before the current Animation has finished.
      Returns:
      the Animation that is un-queued
      Throws:
      com.github.hanyaeger.core.exceptions.YaegerEngineException - thrown if no animation is currently queued

    • unQueueAnimation

      public void unQueueAnimation(Animation animation)
      Call this method to un-queue the specific Animation, if it is currently queued. This method must be called before the current Animation has finished and will only un-queue the queued Animation if it is the same as the Animation passed as the argument.
      Parameters:
      animation - the Animation that should be un-queued
